data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about WiFi Connected Smart Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the WiFi Connected Smart Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The WiFi Connected Smart Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of WiFi Connected Smart Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Good quality. Good quality. Functions well.
1#Buen articulo. Si vieran como Alexa prende y apaga las luces de seguro los compran
2#Worked great at first. Easy instructions, easy set up, good sensitivity of the push button, but after about 5months the wifi quit and now it is basically a regular switch with led indicators.
3#Excelente. Buena construcción y funcionamiento
4#It was working beautifully for 2 months then it died. I loved the switch looks, ease of installation and compactness. However, after 2 months, it died and i can not press any button.
5#Smart switch. Smart choice! I bought this for a client who had a unique light switch setup and this worked perfectly!
6#Excellent! NEUTRAL WIRE REQUIRED. I bought it thinkin my older traditional switch was installed with neutral wired but NO, i didnt have neutral wire on that older switch… this wifi switch to operate NEED neutral wire… was relative easy then to add the neutral wire, routing a wire from the nearest outlet 110v, by the inside wall, to the new switch location.. after that everything was flawless perfect! Buy with confidence!!
7#Good price/average quality. Second time I am buying this. The first one lasted two years. Easy to install and I was happy with it while it worked. Hope the second one lasts longer
8#A++. Fit well to an existing electric box, easy to install, easy to configure
9#Works without interference. Two switches in one box. I bought a different brand and had to replace it because it was constantly turning on and off by itself. This brand works flawlessly.
10#Easy to install and integrate into my home. It was easy to install. Just pull out the old one, twist the wires on...screw it back into the wall, download the app. Turn it on and set it up via the app. Took about 30 minutes tops including app set up.
11#Will not stay connected. We have multiple smart switches and plugs, but I needed a dual switch that fit into a single gang so I got this one. It is terrible. I have reconnected it several times and every time is works for a few minutes and then disconnects. I've tried giving it a static IP on the router amd changing the name, but nothing seems to make it work. Maybe I just got a dud...
12#Doesn't stay connected. The switch is constantly disconnecting from the Wi-Fi. My router is not more then 20ft away. Terrible product. More Amazon Chinese crap.
13#Not to good. Well the little lights on the switch buttons their blue but useless.. they are in when the device is on but when the device is off they are also off. To me that's backwards. You need them on lit. When the device they control is off. So you can see the buttons
14#Use the Tuya app to install. I had to switch my band width from 5 to 2.4ghz to have it work. it does work with Alexa.
15#I'm Not Easily Impressed--But WOW. I've installed well over 100 IoT devices, primarily for Alexa integration. I had just tried an Aqara dual switch with no success (the hub read 2 switched but only passed one to Alexa) and this no-name-brand, especially with generic "Smart Life" app, had me doubting success. Wow--it hooked up so fast and easy (1 slight issue discussed later), even easier than my go-to TP-Link brand (no dual switch choice though) on both the App and Alexa discovery. Both switches Alexa responsive (no Master/Slave button or Grouping issues). The one minor set-up is that it lost it's set-up mode while I was reading instructions. I still had outlet open so I disconnected hot to reset (otherwise it wanted me to go through entire routine) so I suggest you be willing to add quickly to Smart Life to avoid the pairing timeout. After install I killed and restored the breaker to check its power outage recovery (a weak point for many brands) and it restored admirably. Very surprised and pleased with performance and granted a VERY rare 5 stars by me.
16#Works great. Hard to find 2 smart switches in on single box. Works great. The buttons(?) don’t actually push in. Maybe touch sensitive but works great with alexa
17#Totally awesome switch. I purchased an Amazon brand double switch which wouldn’t stay connected to the WiFi. I exchanged the switch but had the same result. After being discouraged twice I ordered this switch for a last hope. It has not disconnected from the Wi-Fi once. It works every time, no matter where I am on the planet. I will buy from this brand from now on. Highly recommend!
18#horrible product, no customer support. Installed to replace 2 switches, took 1 attempt to finally connect, worked ok for 4 months and now randomly shuts lights off after 15 minutes. Amazon doesn't support returns past 90 days, and product has customer satisfaction guarantee, but there is no customer service. Used web site provided by Amazon to contact them, no one responds in the chat and no response to in page contact for over a month. Basically, throwing your money away with this company. Many more options available with actual product support.
19#Easy install. Links to Alexa Immediately. Great product. I use it to control my front lamp post and porch light. Easy on line control. Alexa schedule on off is perfect Highly recommend. 5 Star ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
20#Fallo pronto. Dejo de funcionar a las pocas semanas, apenas lo use 4 semanas.
21#Smart house necessity. Saves steps every day, not having to go to the light switch
22#Nice. Good device for it’s purpose
23#Súper bueno. Es una espectacular compra
24#Works great. Wanted to connect it to my son's echo dot and alarm. Works great and helps him get up on time.
25#Works well with Alexa. Alexa loves it. Works well.
26#Google Home only sees one switch. It worked great for a year, but suddenly Google Home only sees it as one switch. Cannot control two lights independently. I've performed all the troubleshooting steps the manufacturer recommended (25 years of computer/electronics technician experience, here), to no avail. They eventually stopped responding to me. I cannot recommend this product.
27#Excellent product. As advertised very good product
28#Needs Neutral Wire. The product description should state that this switch needs a neutral wire. This was not stated in the pictures or the information and is delaying the installation of a Smart switch. Please edit your description to include this information.
29#Easy to install! Great value
30#Works well with google home. This switch is very responsive and I like that it can be controlled from your phone, google home or buttons.
31#Great product. Great product
32#easy to install and works as expected. easy to install and works as expected. the package arrived on time, the switche was as pictured, it was easy to install, even in a flat that does not have an earth wire (I connected a wire to the internal metal box), and it started working manually right out of the box. the android app is simple to set up and integrates with Google Home quickly, although it is a bit confusing that 3 switches appear (one for everything, and one for each individual lamp), but you get used to it quickly.
33#Poor wifi reception. This dual switch would be great if not for poor wifi reception and it doesn't stay connected to wifi network. I used this control my yard landscaping lights so it needed to turn on at night and off in morning. Using a Google Home routine, it would turn on less than half the time. And likewise in morning, it would off less than half the time. This dual switch was mounted next to a Treatlife single switch and replaced a prior Treatlife switch. I never had any issues with these Treatlife switches in over the past year that they were mounted in this same location. So it is not a router wifi problem. This switch is the problem. It's too bad that this dual switch has such a poor wifi interface because I really wanted to put a regular outlet next to this dual switch. I also tried a dual Youngzuth smart switch but it also had poor wifi reception, however it was even worse in that it wouldn't ever automatically reconnect once it lost wifi connection until I manually reset it. I ultimately had to remove this dual switch and a dumb outlet so that I could go back to 2 separate Treatlife smart wifi switches which are working flawlessly right now. The labeling on the back of the switch is incorrect and shows lack of attention to detail in the design. The black wire's Line In is labeled the same text as one of the brown Load1 outputs, hence there are two wires labeled as "L/Load1" and one of them is actually the Line In. The other brown wire is correctly labeled "Load2".
34#Works exactly as it should. Works exactly as it should. It does use stranded wires as leads for hot neutral and loads so you need wire ties or crim connectors to attach them which requires space. I was able to obtain the space by using it to replace two three way switches and mounting it in a the upstairs location and used the second gang with a blank to hold the wires and ties. I used the former traveler wires marked with white to deliver proper hot and neutral to the downstairs former 3 way locations, along with a porch light switch and put a USB receptacle and a blank in place of the former downstairs 3 ways. Pictures show the switch, next shows the downstairs setup with USB and different switch and in third, I hold up the old style toggle switch cover I replaced. I can now say Alexa, turn on the hall light or Alexa, turn on the living room light. Since this is an older home{1930} I will alert that most consumers would need an electrician to do this installation safely. It is much easier in 1980 and later homes with neutral wires as with most smart switches.
35#INTEGRACIÓN ÚTIL. INTEGRACIÓN ÚTIL MEDIOS
36#Nexete Smart Wi-Fi Double Light Switch, 2 in1 Single Pole Switch. The installation was very easy to install. The sad part is, the wi-fi could not find the wireless switch. I deleted the app multiple times, reinstalled the app and the app could not find the device over multiple tries with no success, at all. The instructions said reset the device to get the light to flash, for the app to sync with the device. I could not find a reset button on the switch. The wireless switch devices can be turned on manually. I decided to work the lights manually and deleted the app from my phone. I read the reviews online and discovered that I was not the only one having trouble with syncing the app with the switch. I will keep the switch and use it manually. My recommendation: Do not purchase this Smart WI-FI Double Light Switch because the app does not work.
37#Love these Switches. I love these switches easy to install easy to operate. Can be controlled through App or Alexa Highly Recommend A+++
38#Disappears from Smart Life app. We have had this switch for quite some time now and it will just disappear from Smart Life. I have many wifi switches and no other has ever disappeared before. To reconnect it I have to cut power to it at the breaker and then add it back into Smart Life. SL remembers it because it calls it by the names I gave to it once it is added back. When it is connected it works flawlessly.
39#No recomiendo. Se calientan, el 3r sw no funciona, y hasta ahora sin respuesta satisfactoria.
40#Difficult To Turn On. It doesn’t turn on very easily by touch, often requiring 4-6 touches/pushes to get it to turn on. This is unacceptable. However, it seemed to work just fine with the app activating on/off. Returned for a refund.
41#Disconnects Constantly. The item is easy to install and works well via touch, however the wifi connection constantly disconnects and the connection from Alexa works for a few days then you have to delete the switch and remove all the wifi settings to relink it. I have only had the switch for a month and have had to reconnect it from scratch to Alexa 3x now. Wifi signal is very strong and all other switches in the same area and even further outside the house in the detached garage work just fine and don’t have this issue. Seems it is an issue with this particular item. All other switches are Kasa Switches. They didn’t make a dual integrated one which is why I purchased this one.
42#Wont Connect to wifi. Have one if these that works fine- another won wont connect to the wifi network. No trouble shooting information and zero customer support.
43#My opinion is a bad product. Difficult to program with Alexa and very sensitive to voltages. My opinion is a bad product.
44#Frustrating, tired of playing cat and mouse trying to keep that thing connected to my network. These are at my dock which has a full signal and over 50 MB per second Internet speed. Anything and everything has great signal there except these. I have to take a pretty good walk into the woods to get to the breaker to switch them off and back on to try to reconnect. Sometimes it works great but most of the time it does not work when I really need it. They are in a metal box but I have put a 1 inch thick plastic extender on the box, drilled holes all over the bottom of the box and I think short of a major electrical job to switch out the boxes I have them in I’m stuck with this problem. I can hold my phone anywhere and everywhere around the switch and I get a full five bars of network signal.
45#Excellent Alexa ready walk switch. Super easy install and seamless integration using smart life app and Alexa
46#Es más bonito instalado que en la foto. Funciona perfecto
47#Not a good experience. Stopped working after two months. It is no more detected in Google or Alexa and used to turn on and off randomly. Latest so update seems to address this issue though. App is also hopeless..
48#Smart house (casa inteligente). Facil de instalar, pedi dos y uno de ellos me lo enviaron usado. Piezas faltantes
49#They work with app, rarely work with Alexa. These work ALMOST always with the app. And RARELY work connected to Alexa. I have a conglomeration of stuff hooked to Alexa these are the only ones I have trouble with. Ended up throwing them away and replacing them with Kasa. Just got tired of fighting them to work with Alexa, I think almost a yr is a fair trial period. Wish more people posted year later reviews.
